title: الاخْتِصَاصُ
description: Learn about الاختصاص - a construction where a noun in accusative specifies and limits a preceding pronoun, as in نَحْنُ العربَ نُكرمُ الضيفَ.

notes.title: What is الاختصاص (Specification)?
content: الاخْتِصَاص is a grammatical construction where a noun in the accusative case follows a first-person pronoun (نَحْنُ or أَنَا) to specify and limit who is meant. It adds pride, humility, or clarification.
The specified noun is called الْمَخْصُوص (the specified) and is مَنْصُوب (accusative) as the object of a deleted verb أَخُصُّ or أَعْنِي (I mean, I specify).

examples.english: We - Arabs - honor the guest
We - Muslims - believe in Allah
I - the student - strive hard
We - the company of prophets - are not inherited from

notes.title: Forms of الاختصاص
content: The مَخْصُوص (specified noun) can take several forms: 1) With أَلْ (definite article): نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ, 2) With إضافة: نَحْنُ مَعْشَرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ, 3) With أَيُّهَا/أَيَّتُهَا: نَحْنُ أَيُّهَا الطُّلَّابُ.
The construction always begins with a first-person pronoun (متكلم). Using second or third person pronouns is not الاختصاص but would be نِدَاء (vocative) or something else.

examples.english: We teachers seek goodness (with أَلْ)
We scholars serve the nation (with إضافة)
We, O people, are weak (with أَيُّهَا)
I, son of nobles, keep the covenant

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis (الإعراب)
content: The مَخْصُوص is مَفْعُول بِهِ لِفِعْلٍ مَحْذُوفٍ وُجُوبًا (object of an obligatorily deleted verb). The estimated verb is أَخُصُّ (I specify) or أَعْنِي (I mean).
The pronoun (نَحْنُ/أَنَا) is مُبْتَدَأ, and the verb after الاختصاص is the خَبَر (or contains the خَبَر). The الاختصاص phrase is parenthetical (جُمْلَة اعْتِرَاضِيَّة).

examples.arabic: نَحْنُ: ضَمِيرٌ مُنْفَصِلٌ مَبْنِيٌّ فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ مُبْتَدَأ
examples.english: نَحْنُ: separate pronoun, in place of nominative, subject

examples.arabic: الْعَرَبَ: مَفْعُول بِهِ لِفِعْلٍ مَحْذُوفٍ تَقْدِيرُهُ أَخُصُّ
examples.english: الْعَرَبَ: object of deleted verb estimated as أَخُصُّ

examples.arabic: نُكْرِمُ: فِعْلٌ مُضَارِعٌ وَالْفَاعِلُ ضَمِيرٌ مُسْتَتِر (نَحْنُ)
examples.english: نُكْرِمُ: present verb, subject is hidden pronoun

examples.arabic: الْجُمْلَة الْفِعْلِيَّة فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ خَبَر
examples.english: The verbal sentence is in place of nominative, predicate

notes.title: Purpose and Usage
content: الاختصاص serves several rhetorical purposes: 1) الْفَخْر (pride): نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ أَهْلُ الْكَرَمِ, 2) التَّوَاضُع (humility): نَحْنُ الْعَبِيدَ نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ, 3) التَّوْضِيح (clarification): specifying which group is meant.
It is common in speeches, poetry, and religious texts where the speaker wants to identify with a group while making a statement about that group's characteristics or actions.

examples.english: We - Quraysh - are chiefs of Arabs (pride)
We - the poor - ask Allah (humility)
We - people of the house - love goodness (clarification)
I - the sinner - seek Allah's forgiveness (humility)

notes.title: Difference from النداء (Vocative)
content: الاختصاص differs from النداء in several ways: 1) الاختصاص uses first-person pronouns only (نَحْنُ/أَنَا), while النداء typically addresses second person, 2) The specified noun in الاختصاص is the speaker themselves, not someone being called.

When أَيُّهَا appears after نَحْنُ, it looks like vocative but is actually الاختصاص. Compare: نَحْنُ أَيُّهَا الطُّلَّابُ نَجْتَهِدُ (specification) vs. يَا أَيُّهَا الطُّلَّابُ اجْتَهِدُوا (vocative).

examples.english: We students strive (specification)
O students, strive! (vocative)
We believers are patient (specification)
O believers, be patient! (vocative)

notes.title: Classical Examples
content: الاختصاص appears frequently in hadith and classical Arabic. The Prophet ﷺ said: نَحْنُ مَعَاشِرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ لَا نُورَثُ (We, the company of prophets, are not inherited from).

In poetry, it is used for dramatic effect and to establish group identity. Grammarians like Ibn Malik devoted sections to it in their works, considering it essential for understanding classical texts.
keyPoints: Common in Hadith and classical texts

examples.english: We, the company of prophets, are not inherited from (Hadith)

examples.arabic: إِنَّا مَعَاشِرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ تَنَامُ أَعْيُنُنَا وَلَا تَنَامُ قُلُوبُنَا
examples.english: We prophets - our eyes sleep but our hearts do not (Hadith)
We, sons of Dabba, are companions of the camel
I am son of prominence, climber of heights (poetry)

exercises.prompt: نَحْنُ - الْعَرَبَ - نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ: هَذَا أُسْلُوبُ _____
exercises.promptEn: نَحْنُ - الْعَرَبَ - نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ: this is the style of _____
The accusative noun in الاختصاص is called: _____

exercises.prompt: الْفِعْلُ الْمَحْذُوفُ فِي الاخْتِصَاصِ تَقْدِيرُهُ: _____ أَوْ أَعْنِي
exercises.promptEn: The deleted verb in الاختصاص is estimated as: _____ or أَعْنِي

exercises.prompt: الاخْتِصَاصُ يَأْتِي بَعْدَ ضَمِيرِ _____ فَقَطْ (نَحْنُ أَوْ أَنَا)
exercises.promptEn: الاختصاص comes only after _____ person pronouns (نَحْنُ or أَنَا)

exercises.prompt: مِنْ أَغْرَاضِ الاخْتِصَاصِ: الْفَخْرُ وَالتَّوَاضُعُ وَ_____
exercises.promptEn: Among purposes of الاختصاص: pride, humility, and _____

exercises.prompt: نَحْنُ مَعَاشِرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ لَا نُورَثُ - 'مَعَاشِرَ' هُنَا: _____ بِهِ لِفِعْلٍ مَحْذُوف
exercises.promptEn: نَحْنُ مَعَاشِرَ الأَنْبِيَاءِ لَا نُورَثُ - 'مَعَاشِرَ' here is: _____ of a deleted verb

exercises.answer: Specification (accusative noun specifying a first-person pronoun)
The specified noun (the accusative noun in الاختصاص)
We Arabs honor the guest (الاختصاص example)

exercises.prompt: The construction where a noun specifies who is meant after نَحْنُ or أَنَا
The hadith 'We, the company of prophets, are not inherited from' in Arabic
The deleted verb estimated in الاختصاص meaning 'I specify'
